pages.text: One of the last known trigonotarbids, Permotarbus schuberti lived during the Early Permian. It is known from the "Permian Petrified Forest" of Chemnitz in Germany. This forest, consisting of tree-ferns, Calamites-like plants and early conifers, was preserved by ash layers from volcanic eruptions.
